heroDescription: Denver, the Mile High City, is known for its vibrant culture and outdoor lifestyle.
landscapeDescription: Denver's economy is diverse, driven by technology, healthcare, and tourism. The city is a hub for startups and established companies alike.
uniqueNeeds: Denver requires a focus on sustainable growth and infrastructure to support its expanding population.
citySpecificRiskAdvice: Denver's tech sector is booming, but housing prices pose bubble risks. Natural disasters like wildfires and flooding are concerns; diversify investments.

sections.title: Economic Growth
sections.description: According to BEA (2023), Denver's GDP growth rate is projected at 4.2%, driven by tech and healthcare sectors.

sections.title: Wealth Demographics
sections.description: According to Census (2023), the median household income in Denver is $70,000, reflecting a growing affluent population.

sections.title: Advisor Specializations
sections.description: Based on BLS (2023), financial advisors in Denver increasingly specialize in tech investments and retirement planning.

sections.title: Cost of Living
sections.description: According to BLS (2024), Denver's cost of living has risen by 5% due to housing and transportation expenses.

sections.title: Real Estate Market
sections.description: According to Zillow (2024), the median home price in Denver is $550,000, with a 10% increase year-over-year.

sections.title: Business Environment
sections.description: According to Fortune (2024), Denver ranks as one of the top cities for startups, with a supportive business ecosystem.
